summary: Joseph H. Kearney Jr. is mentioned in three documents related to the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) investigation into the assassinations of Martin Luther King Jr. and John F. Kennedy. The documents consist of communications between the FBI, its field offices, and the HSCA. These communications include requests for files, informant information, and agent details. The documents do not provide specific details about Kearney's role or involvement, but his name appears in the context of FBI responses to HSCA requests for information related to the assassinations.
significance: Based on the provided documents, the significance of Joseph H. Kearney Jr. in the JFK assassination context is unclear. His name appears in the context of FBI communications with the HSCA, suggesting he may have been an FBI agent or someone whose records were relevant to the HSCA investigation. Further information is needed to determine his specific role or significance.
